Diagnosis. Species of the genus
Breda
differ from those of the remaining genera of Salticidae by having the base of the embolus well developed, covering partially the bulb of the male palp in ventral view, with a retrolateral proximal depression (
Figs 10 ‚Äì11
, 15‚Äì16 , 24 ), and a large croissant-shaped atrium with posterior concavity on the epigynal plate of the females, through which it is possible to see the anteriorly placed spermathecae (
Figs 12‚Äì13
).
